flexibleText:
This is based on a checklist by Geoff Kenyon on Moz.

This checklist is part of a comprehensive series on critical checklists for web development.

WARNING: There are several references to Google Analytics in this checklist, without mention of any alternatives. Google Analytics is a major player in the analytics space, mainly because it is a "free" product, but there are privacy implications when you get in bed with a monopoly like Google. At ch.ckl.st, we are sensitive about protecting our users' privacy and avoid the use of Google Analytics. Some alternatives include:

  1. Simple Analytics
  2. Fathom Analytics
  3. Matomo

checklistItems.label: Check indexed pages
checklistItems.flexibleText:
• Do a "site:" search, i.e. search for the term "site: [yoursite.com]"
  • How many pages are returned? (This can be way off so don't put too much stock in this).
  • Is the homepage showing up as the first result?
  • If the homepage isn't showing up as the first result, there could be issues, like a penalty or poor site architecture/internal linking, affecting the site. This may be less of a concern as Google's John Mueller recently said that your homepage doesn't need to be listed first.

checklistItems.label: Review the number of organic landing pages in Google Analytics
checklistItems.flexibleText:
• Does this match with the number of results in a site: search?
  • This is often the best view of how many pages are in a search engine's index that search engines find valuable.

checklistItems.label: Search for the brand and branded terms
checklistItems.flexibleText:
• Is the homepage showing up at the top, or are correct pages showing up?
  • If the proper pages aren't showing up as the first result, there could be issues, like a penalty, in play.

checklistItems.label: Check Google's cache for key pages
checklistItems.flexibleText:
• Is the content showing up?
  • Are navigation links present?
  • Are there links that aren't visible on the site?

checklistItems.label: Check text-only version of cached pages
checklistItems.flexibleText:
Here is a bookmarklet to help you do that.

If you are not familiar with bookmarklets, Mozilla offers an excellent explanation.

checklistItems.label: Do a mobile search for your brand and key landing pages
checklistItems.flexibleText:
• Does your listing have the "mobile friendly" label?
  • Are your landing pages mobile friendly?
  • If the answer is no to either of these, it may be costing you organic visits.

checklistItems.label: Check for mobile friendliness
checklistItems.flexibleText:
• Google uses mobile optimization as a ranking factor.
  • Mobile optimization as a competitive advantage.

checklistItems.label: Title tags are optimized
checklistItems.flexibleText:
• Title tags should be optimized and unique.
  • Your brand name should be included in your title tag to improve click-through rates.
  • Title tags are about 55-60 characters (512 pixels) to be fully displayed. You can test here or review title pixel widths in Screaming Frog.

checklistItems.label: Important pages have click-through rate optimized titles and meta descriptions
checklistItems.flexibleText:
• This will help improve your organic traffic independent of your rankings.
  • You can use SERP Turkey for this.

checklistItems.label: Check for pages missing page titles and meta descriptions
On-page content includes the primary keywords
checklistItems.flexibleText: The on-page content includes the primary keyword phrase multiple times as well as variations and alternate keyword phrases.

checklistItems.label: Review content on key pages
checklistItems.flexibleText: There is a significant amount of optimized, unique content on key pages.

checklistItems.label: H1 tags contains keywords
checklistItems.flexibleText: The primary keyword phrase is contained in the H1 tag.

checklistItems.label: Image file names and alt text include keywords
checklistItems.flexibleText: Images' file names and alt text are optimized to include the primary keyword phrase associated with the page.

checklistItems.label: URLs are descriptive and optimized
checklistItems.flexibleText: While it is beneficial to include your keyword phrase in URLs, changing your URLs can negatively impact traffic when you do a 301. As such, I typically recommend optimizing URLs when the current ones are really bad or when you don't have to change URLs with existing external links.

checklistItems.label: Clean, short URLs
checklistItems.flexibleText:
• No excessive parameters or session IDs.
  • URLs exposed to search engines should be static.
  • 115 characters or shorter â€“ this character limit isn't set in stone, but shorter URLs are better for usability.

Additional reading:

  • Best Practices for URLs
  • URL Rewriting Tool
  • mod_rewrite Cheat Sheet
  • Creating 301 Redirects With .htaccess

checklistItems.label: Homepage content is optimized
checklistItems.flexibleText:
• Does the homepage have at least one paragraph?
  • There has to be enough content on the page to give search engines an understanding of what a page is about. At least 150 words are recommended.

checklistItems.label: Landing pages are optimized
checklistItems.flexibleText:
• Do these pages have at least a few paragraphs of content? Is it enough to give search engines an understanding of what the page is about?
  • Is it template text or is it completely unique?

checklistItems.label: Site contains real and substantial content
checklistItems.flexibleText: Is there real content on the site or is the "content" simply a list of links?

checklistItems.label: Proper keyword targeting
checklistItems.flexibleText:
• Does the intent behind the keyword match the intent of the landing page?
  • Are there pages targeting head terms, mid-tail, and long-tail keywords?

checklistItems.label: Keyword cannibalization
checklistItems.flexibleText:
• Do a site: search in Google for important keyword phrases.
  • Check for duplicate content/page titles.

checklistItems.label: Content to help users convert exists and is easily accessible to users
checklistItems.flexibleText: In addition to search engine driven content, there should be content to help educate users about the product or service.

checklistItems.label: Content formatting
checklistItems.flexibleText:
• Is the content formatted well and easy to read quickly?
  • Are H tags used?
  • Are images used?
  • Is the text broken down into easy to read paragraphs?

checklistItems.label: Good headlines on blog posts
checklistItems.flexibleText: Good headlines go a long way. Make sure the headlines are well written and draw users in.

checklistItems.label: Amount of content versus ads
checklistItems.flexibleText:
• Since the implementation of Panda, the amount of ad-space on a page has become important to evaluate.
  • Make sure there is significant unique content above the fold.
  • If you have more ads than unique content, you are probably going to have a problem.

sections.title: Content
sections.flexibleText:
Additional reading:

  • How to Write Magnetic Headlines
  • SEO Copywriting Tips for Improved Link Building
  • The Ultimate Blogger Writing Guide
  • Tips to Earn Links and Tweets to Your Blog Post

checklistItems.label: There should be one URL for each piece of content
checklistItems.flexibleText:
• Do URLs include parameters or tracking code? This will result in multiple URLs for a piece of content.
  • Does the same content reside on completely different URLs? This is often due to products/content being replicated across different categories.

checklistItems.label: Do a search to check for duplicate content
checklistItems.flexibleText:
• Take a content snippet, put it in quotes and search for it.
  • Does the content show up elsewhere on the domain?
  • Has it been scraped? If the content has been scraped, you should file a content removal request with Google.

checklistItems.label: Sub-domain duplicate content
checklistItems.flexibleText: Does the same content exist on different sub-domains?

checklistItems.label: Check for a secure and non-secure versions of the site
checklistItems.flexibleText: Does the same content exist on secure and non-secure versions of the site? Search engines will treat this as duplicate content. In current times, there is hardly any reason why your site should be delivered over a non-https-connection.

checklistItems.label: Check for "print" pages
checklistItems.flexibleText: If there are "printer friendly" versions of pages, they may be causing duplicate content.

sections.title: Duplicate Content
sections.flexibleText: Duplicate content carries a penalty with search engines. Avoid it. Here are some things to look out for.

checklistItems.label: Check the robots.txt
checklistItems.flexibleText: Has the entire site, or important content been blocked? Is link equity being orphaned due to pages being blocked via the robots.txt?

checklistItems.label: Turn off JavaScript, cookies, and CSS
checklistItems.flexibleText:
• Use the Web Developer Toolbar
  • Is the content there?
  • Do the navigation links work?

checklistItems.label: Now change your user agent to Googlebot
checklistItems.flexibleText:
• How to for both Chrome and Firefox
  • Does it look the same as before?

checklistItems.label: XML sitemaps are listed in the robots.txt file
XML sitemaps are submitted
checklistItems.flexibleText:
• For Google
  • For Bing

checklistItems.label: Check pages for meta robots noindex tag
checklistItems.flexibleText:
• Are pages accidentally being tagged with the meta robots noindex command
  • Are there pages that should have the noindex command applied
  • You can check the site quickly via a crawl tool such as Moz or Screaming Frog

checklistItems.label: Do goal pages have the noindex command applied?
checklistItems.flexibleText: This is important to prevent direct organic visits from showing up as goals in analytics.

checklistItems.label: Number of links on a page
checklistItems.flexibleText: 100-200 is a good target, but not a rule.

checklistItems.label: Vertical linking structures are in place
checklistItems.flexibleText:
• Homepage links to category pages.
  • Category pages link to sub-category and product pages as appropriate.
  • Product pages link to relevant category pages.

checklistItems.label: Horizontal linking structures are in place
checklistItems.flexibleText:
• Category pages link to other relevant category pages.
  • Product pages link to other relevant product pages.

checklistItems.label: Links are in content
checklistItems.flexibleText: Does not utilize massive blocks of links stuck in the content to do internal linking.

checklistItems.label: Footer links
checklistItems.flexibleText:
• Does not use a block of footer links instead of proper navigation.
  • Does not link to landing pages with optimized anchors.

checklistItems.label: Good internal anchor text
Check for broken links
checklistItems.flexibleText: Link Checker and Xenu are good tools for this.

sections.title: Site Architecture and Internal Linking
sections.flexibleText:
Additional reading:

  • Importance of Internal Linking
  • Internal Linking Tactics
  • Using Anchor Links to Make Google Ignore The First Link
  • Successful Site Architecture for SEO
  • The SEO Guide to Site Architecture
  • Information Architecture and Faceted Navigation

checklistItems.label: Proper use of 301s
checklistItems.flexibleText:
• Are 301s being used for all redirects?
  • If the root is being directed to a landing page, are they using a 301 instead of a 302?
  • Use Header Analyzer Firefox plugin to check 301s.

checklistItems.label: "Bad" redirects are avoided
checklistItems.flexibleText:
• These include 302s (temporary redirects), 307s, meta refresh, and JavaScript redirects as they pass little to no value.
  • These redirects can easily be identified with a tool like Screaming Frog.

checklistItems.label: Redirects point directly to the final URL and do not leverage redirect chains
checklistItems.flexibleText:
• Redirect chains significantly diminish the amount of link equity associated with the final URL.
  • Google has said that they will stop following a redirect chain after several redirects.

checklistItems.label: Check for errors in Google Webmaster Tools
checklistItems.flexibleText: Google WMT will give you a good list of technical problems that they are encountering on your site (such as: 4xx and 5xx errors, inaccessible pages in the XML sitemap, and soft 404s).

checklistItems.label: XML Sitemaps
checklistItems.flexibleText:
• Are XML sitemaps in place?
  • Are XML sitemaps covering for poor site architecture?
  • Are XML sitemaps structured to show indexation problems?
  • Do the sitemaps follow proper XML protocols?

checklistItems.label: Canonical version of the site established through 301s
Canonical version of site is specified in Google Webmaster Tools
Rel canonical link tag is properly implemented across the site
checklistItems.flexibleText: Make sure it points to the correct page, and every page doesn't point to the homepage.

checklistItems.label: Uses absolute URLs instead of relative URLs
checklistItems.flexibleText: This can cause a lot of problems if you have a root domain with secure sections.

checklistItems.label: Review page load time for key pages
checklistItems.flexibleText: Is it significant for users or search engines?

checklistItems.label: Make sure compression is enabled
Enable caching
Optimize your images for the web
checklistItems.flexibleText: Google's guide to optimizing your images.

checklistItems.label: Minify your CSS/JS/HTML
Use a good, fast host and CDN

sections.title: Site Speed
sections.flexibleText:
Additional reading:

  • Google Page Speed Insights
  • Best Practices for Page Speed
  • Lighthouse

checklistItems.label: Review international versions indicated in the URL
checklistItems.flexibleText: ex: site.com/uk/ or uk.site.com

checklistItems.label: Enable country based targeting in webmaster tools
checklistItems.flexibleText:
• If the site is targeted to one specific country, is this specified in webmaster tools?
  • If the site has international sections, are they targeted in webmaster tools?

checklistItems.label: Implement hreflang / rel alternate if relevant
checklistItems.flexibleText: Documentation.

checklistItems.label: Different country, same language
checklistItems.flexibleText: If there are multiple versions of a site in the same language (such as /us/ and /uk/, both in English), update the copy so that they are both unique.

checklistItems.label: Make sure the currency reflects the country targeted
Ensure the URL structure is in the native language
checklistItems.flexibleText: Try to avoid having all URLs in the default language.

checklistItems.label: Analytics tracking code is on every page
checklistItems.flexibleText:
• You can check this using the "custom" filter in a Screaming Frog Crawl or by looking for self referrals.
  • Are there pages that should be blocked?

checklistItems.label: Analytics is properly tracking and capturing internal searches
Demographics tracking is set up
Internal IP addresses are excluded
Meta refresh and JavaScript redirects are avoided
checklistItems.flexibleText: These can artificially lower bounce rates.

checklistItems.label: Event tracking is set up for key user interactions
checklistItems.flexibleText: An example from Google Analytics.
